meaningMnemonic: The <kanji>prefecture</kanji> famous for its ancient <kanji>thorn</kanji> <kanji>castle</kanji> is <vocabulary>Ibaraki prefecture</vocabulary>. I may or may not be making this up. Don't fact check me, just look at that cool thorny castle in Ibaraki that I put in your head. Ooooh, how cool!
readingMnemonic:
This word consists of the kun'yomi reading for 茨, and exception for 城 and the on'yomi for 県. Phew! You haven't learned this weird reading for 城 yet, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

<vocabulary>Ibaraki prefecture</vocabulary> is famous for making <reading>key</reading>s (き)! It's their biggest export. The key to knowing this reading is in the keys they make! Or, just knowing that it's the same in English and Japanese.
